required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to confirm the Garmin ECG (electrocardiogram) software algorithm can detect and classify atrial fibrillation and normal sinus rhythm on single lead ECG data derived from a Garmin wrist-worn, consumer device. The study will also confirm the software's ability to create a Lead I ECG that is clinically equivalent to a reference device. The Garmin ECG software is not a diagnostic system and is intended for informational purposes only.

primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with a SR software rhythm classification in agreement with a physician's interpretation of heart rhythm based on gold standard 12-lead ECG
Number of participants with an AF software rhythm classification in agreement with a physician's interpretation of heart rhythm based on gold standard 12-lead ECG

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of ECGs that pass a visual overlay
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with software's ability to produce a clinically equivalent waveform in agreement to a gold standard Lead I reference

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in R-wave amplitudes between the software and gold standard reference
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with software's ability to produce a clinically equivalent waveform in agreement to a gold standard Lead I reference

arm_group.description: Patients with a known history of AF who are in AF at the time of study screening.
Patients with no known diagnosis of AF or other arrhythmia

intervention.description: Simultaneous assessment of the heart rhythm determined from a 12-lead ECG and the Garmin ECG software algorithm heart rhythm classification on single-lead ECG data derived from the wearable device. All participants will record three simultaneous 12-lead and single-lead ECGs.

facility.name: Northwell Health North Shore University Hospital
MedStar Health Cardiac Electrophysiology at Fairfax
